VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {3} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Biomass relative to the peak of Hybrid Systems in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Biomass is to the {right} of the peak of Hybrid Systems.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Hybrid Systems show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Hybrid Systems shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Hybrid Systems reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Hybrid Systems} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =91.9?
EVJ.A: At X =91.9,the label with the highest density is {Hydroelectric}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 50? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 56? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Biomass or Hybrid Systems?
NC.A: {Biomass} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Hydroelectric or Biomass?
NC.A: {Hydroelectric} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {1} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Hybrid Systems}
